intro: Chondrosea diapensioides, commonly known as the creeping yellowweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are prostrate and often root at the nodes. Chondrosea diapensioides thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
